BY ADVS. SRI.NIREESH MATHEW SRI.N.P.PRAJEESH RESPONDENT/S: STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM, KOCHI- 682031. OTHER PRESENT: SRI ALEX M THOMBRA- SR PUBLIC PROSECUTOR BalsroRs Tal iene fe 4 te 2019/KER/1058 Crl.MC.No. 191 of 2019 14.. THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ORDER Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C. 2. Petitioners are the accused in CC No. 4516 of 2012 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Irinjalakkuda. They are alleged to have committed the offences under sections 7 and 8 of the Kerala Gaming Act (for short, the Act). The proceedings are sought to be quashed on the ground that the prosecution has no case that the incident took place in a common gaming house. 3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and the learned Public Prosecutor. 4, It is not in dispute that to attract sections 7 and 8 of the Act the incident should take place in a common gaming house. In this case eae 2019/KER/1058 Crl.MC.No. 191 of 2019 1.5e. the prosecution has no such allegation. It follows that the proceedings against the petitioners are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C is allowed. The proceedings in CC No. 4516 of 2012 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Irinjalakkuda are quashed. Rs.1,00,000/- (Rupees One lakh only) out of the money seized from the petitioners shall be credited to the Chief Ministers Distress Relief Fund and the balance amount shall be refunded to the petitioners. Sd/- K.ABRAHAM MATHEW JUDGE Bka/10.01.2019 ie CE 4 ie 2019/KER/1058 Cr1l.MC.No. 191 of 2019 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE A TRUE PHOTOCOPY OF THE FIRST INFORMATION REPORT DATED 03.06.2012 IN CRIME NO.742/2012 OF PUDUKKAD POLICE STATION.
